titleInfo.title: ‘File 15/36 I Departmental Examination of officers of the I.M.D.'

physicalDescription.extent: File papers are arranged chronologically. They are followed by file notes (folio 5) which include a chronological list of the two main enclosures in the file, together with their document reference number and folio number, to help identify and locate them in the file.

Foliation is written in pencil, in the top right corner of the recto of each folio. It begins on the first folio after the front cover, on number 1, and ends on the last folio of writing, on number 5.

mods.abstract: The file contains one main document: a letter from the Government of India, Defence Department, Army Branch, New Delhi, 23 December 1939, to the Director General, Indian Medical Service (IMS). The letter notifies the Director General of the Government’s decision to suspend departmental examinations for the promotion of Assistant and Sub-Assistant Surgeons of the Indian Medical Department (IMD), for the duration of the Second World War (1939-1945). The letter was copied to The Political Agent, Bahrain and the Medical Officer, Trucial Coast, at Dubai.
